item.title: Call for feedback! The Engineering Working Group needs your feedback on the proposal to change the data model: You can read the latest update on http://OSM.org from Jochen Topf https://blog.openstreetmap.org/?p=176655718

The blog post about the new communities tab on http://OSM.org is in many respects a story about volunteering for OSM. Check it out--and then maybe head on over to this link and review some pull requests! https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website/issues/3815

And what is the new #OSM "Communities page" you might ask? Read all about it at the link. (With thanks to @joostjakob@twitter.com @gravitystorm@twitter.com and Adam Hoyle) https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/12/30/introducing-the-communities-tab-on-osm-org/
And here's #3 - the new "Communities" page on http://OSM.org https://community.openstreetmap.org/
Here's #2 - the OSM Discourse Community: https://community.openstreetmap.org/
Thanks to @__seav__@twitter.com we have a small "quiz" about three OSM URLS. Here's #1: https://openstreetmap.community/

Some highlights: There is a new digital meeting place for cartography and geospatial professionals and enthusiasts -- to find the link to this unnamed space, just visit the weeklyOSM! RT @weeklyOSM@twitter.com weeklyOSM issue 649 now available in *English* the news from the #openstreetmap #osm world https://www.weeklyosm.eu/archives/16214 üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/weeklyOSM/status/1609511098176135172

The OSMF Board has released a statement on Overture Maps. We welcome the community‚Äôs feedback, questions and discussions. Views from the OpenStreetMap Foundation on the launch of Overture https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/12/22/views-from-the-openstreetmap-foundation-on-the-launch-of-overture/

Got some free time over the holiday season? There are over 67 pull requests over on https://github.com/openstreetmap/openstreetmap-website @gravitystorm@twitter.com has raised a "help wanted" issue (#3815), saying, "I'm sure you can find one of interest to you!"

and finally... Here is a breakdown of OSMF members eligible to vote in the board elections this year, as well as context on the eligibility requirements and predictions. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Doro8ea/diary/400540

Reports from the Financial Working Group (fka Fundraising Working Group), and the Personnel Committee. https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Annual_General_Meetings/2022/Fundraising https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Annual_General_Meetings/2022/Personnel_committee%27s_report
Treasurer‚Äôs report from Roland Olbricht https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Annual_General_Meetings/2022/Treasurer%E2%80%99s_report
Other business from the Annual General Meeting: The Chairperson‚Äôs report from @grischard@twitter.com (the outgoing chair) https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Stereo/diary/400544

Some headlines from this week's edition: We have four new board members. In alphabetical order: Craig Allan (@craig_allan_za@twitter.com) Sarah Hoffmann Mateusz Konieczny Arnalie Vicario (@arnalielsewhere@twitter.com) https://twitter.com/esopenstreetmap/status/1601651606042415108?s=20&t=WkxCpGk0iDlBCTSoiQJEVg

RT @esopenstreetmap@twitter.com Finalizadas las elecciones de la #OpenStreetMap Foundation, los nuevos miembros de la Junta OSM son: Arnalie Vicario @arnalielsewhere@twitter.com, Sarah Hoffmann, Mateusz Konieczny, y Craig Allan @craig_allan_za@twitter.com Pueden mirar c√≥mo fue la elecci√≥n en: https://www.opavote.com/results/5994558109253632 üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/esopenstreetmap/status/1601651606042415108
The Weekly OSM is out: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/16183

Although OSMF has been employing people and paying some contractors recently, this is still dwarfed by very generous donations of time & effort from volunteer working groups, board, and (of course) our mapping community. Wishing a happy #InternationalVolunteerDay2022 to you all!

Once more for the people in the back - the Engineering Working Group has a new call for proposals up on the blog! Requirements are in French, Spanish, Arabic, Dutch and Swahili. All the details are linked in the post: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/
This is just a few weeks worth . . . üôåüèª https://osmcal.org/
There are SO MANY #OSM events - have you noticed this? You can add yours to the OSM calendar--which, amongst other things means it will appear in the weeklyOSM newsletter https://osmcal.org/
